cFCmuU-ypWNwBT2v3gqsZA.text: As members, we never expected the front house staff to be so pretentious and condescending.  Edited to respond to Stephen's follow up comment below: all but one in our party were dress code compliant. We would have been fine and would have never made this post if the entrance staff would have merely said 'unfortunately, you aren't dress code complaint because of x.' However, that didn't happen. How the doorman handled the matter was the issue. You don't have to be a snobby jerk to politely tell a member someone isn't dress code compliant.  Your response supports my review- instead of saying 'Hey, sorry you had a bad experience. Although we have a dress code we need to enforce, maybe we could have handled the exchange better.' You give a condescending, patronizing response, which shows a lack of professionalism and customer service skills thereby supporting my 1-star review.

g6O6uOtgdktE6l3CfDUirw.text: Amazing experience. We will be back if nothing else, just to talk to the owner Stefan. He was so great, very knowledgeable and engaging. We could have stayed for hours!   What to get: we got many drinks and loved all of them. The Richardson was good for anyone who likes manhattans and old fashioneds. We also got a Manhattan and old fashioned too! My husband did a vieux Carre and just some whiskey. Their whiskey selection is incredible and much of it is barrel pours for just them. So neat. We also got a small cheese plate which was good!  Only downside, the drinks must be a bit stronger than most, we were hurting a little the next day!

r3wGmcSI1g-jWnW4p00SqA.text: I've been here 3 times now, twice as a member and I think it's my favorite cocktail bar/speakeasy in Charlotte. One of the best things you can do is sit at the bar so that you can talk to the bartenders and get recommendations. For us, this means coming on Sunday nights when it's pretty quiet. On Sundays they also have a specials menu for $8 cocktails which is a super good deal considering that they are made to the same level as all of their $14/15 cocktails.  Both times my husband and I have sat at the bar, we've been served by Andrew the bartender... but actually two different Andrews! Both amazing in their own merit though.  The first Andrew treated us right for our one year anniversary and made me a tropical cocktail with a tiny message in a bottle wishing us a happy anniversary! The second Andrew recommended a drink on the menu that my husband ordered because he created it himself inspired by his grandfather and proceeded to tell us why he chose the ingredients he chose. I love the personality in their drinks and all the thoughtfulness that goes into it too! It's a great intimate space and we will definitely be making the most of our membership :)

8zPRpH5TnUMDlDrf3awYQA.text: Arrived. Dress code compliant. Put name on wait list. 20 minutes until we are allowed to get in.  Manager escorts two members of our party in to pee. Plenty of empty tables inside.  Other people arrive. Walk right in.  Other other people arrive, walk right in.  12 minutes have gone by.  Other other other people arrive. Half are members and walk right in. Other half aren't members, wait two minutes, walk right in.  17 minutes have gone by.  Other other other other people arrive, walk right in.  21 minutes have gone by. We call a Lyft because fuck this artificial manufacturing of demand for something that probably isn't any better than any other bar.  25 minutes. "Your table is almost ready!"  "We called a Lyft because it's been more than 20 minutes."  "Oh, y'all are gonna dip? We'll see you next time!"  "Nope."  EDIT to reflect Stephen's comments: If you have a response to this review, please write it in English. Take care.

i_2HAhmGm3oozWs-9ru_Mw.text: This members only club is a great addition to the Park Road Shopping area. High end cocktails, cozy atmosphere, and knowledgeable/friendly staff. As a club, they enforce certain dress code rules and seating arrangements that really add to the experience you're paying for to enjoy. Didn't get to try the food, but look forward to trying it.

9xZDx8oUyiSF9kNWue6xpQ.text: I love Dot Dot Dot!   This bar has my most favorite craft cocktail I've ever tasted, Lily Wants a Pony! It was the first drink I ordered here. It has strong rosemary flavor with lime. Has a hint of sweetness and is refreshing.   The atmosphere here is amazing. It was pretty well hidden for a first timer and made the speakeasy experience feel very real. The interior is well designed. I did feel like I was transplanted to a nice bar in New York.  The prices for drink here were pretty reasonable in my opinion. Almost every cocktail on the menu was at or below $15. I've been to other bars in Charlotte that are well over that.

XxDtTPQ4zXFnpWsssHC3qg.text: Stefan is that dude!   Great place all around but don't plan on watching tv at all, that is a no no. Get there early, make a friend and call an Uber:-) Food is incredible as well, felt like I was on some sort posh, v.i.p. vintage ocean liner.   Bravo!

Cac2WVHHmGIjcVLmx5OOnw.text: One of the best, if not THE best cocktail bar in Charlotte. These guys are well trained industry professionals with creativity and knowledge. This is not the bar for a Rum and Coke (although I'm sure they could spruce that up and make it something memorable and amazing.)  As I'm SURE that all of you know, you need a membership in order to come here. Membership is $10 and covers you and up to 3 guests, and I'm pretty sure it lasts for a year. The Lady and I didn't have one when we arrived, so we purchased one at the door (card only, no cash at the outside podium.)  We were led inside and offered a table, but let's be real. The bar is the only place to sit here. We spent the whole evening with Andrew (the one with the longer hair, not the shorter hair one who was also working at the bar...confusing haha) who after one drink, we trusted telling him flavors that we liked and having him craft *something* for us. The cocktails here are nothing short of incredible. Everything from the flavors to the glass choice to the presentation are at the highest level. Price reflects that, but I 100% believe that the cost represents the value, and I'm willing to pay for value.  We ordered three plates of food as well - scallops, the gnocchi carbonara, and the carrots as a 'dessert'. All three were awesome - refined, and delicious. Portions were mid-sized, not quite as small as tapas but definitely not entree.   Andrew introduced us to a lot of new flavors in cocktails and shared each recipe willingly - I even took home one that I had never tried before but want to recreate!   We WILL be back here, and hopefully soon, to sit nowhere else but the bar. Dot Dot Dot is our new 'nice' night out destination. I'm sorry we waited so long.

Dq4jBC648wttXPvJUmo4bQ.text: I kept waiting to give Dot Dot Dot a review because I kept thinking it couldn't be 5 stars *every* time. Spoiler alert: it can be. The fella and I have been for drinks many times and dinner once; each time we've sat at the bar, and it's been the best experience. The bartenders introduce themselves, ask what you like, get to know you, etc. - but not in a weird way where you're wishing they'd get out of your business.  What I love the most is that each bartender is so educated and well-versed, I can give them my parameters (no rum or tequila, a little sweet, a little heat), and I get a different and amazing drink each time. It's fun to watch people do what they're good at and enjoy. And the food is just as on point.  Yes, you have to pay $10 for a membership, and yes, there's a dress code, but it's also a place for grown-ups. I can't get the fella to give up his shorts when it's 20 degrees outside, and even he'll put on a pair of jeans to come here.

dccA8A6YFtNL3HxS8Z6H1Q.text: We grabbed cocktails here last night before dinner at flourshop and overall really liked it! The setup to sign up and get in is a little cheesy (having to sign up outside and walk down the hallway) but once you get in the decor is classy, cozy and appropriate for a speakeasy! I got the strawberry fizz and my boyfriend got a bourbon/tequila cocktail and both were tasty and well presented. Would love to come back for food another time!

ApECvk_ZMSBYnS7BKOc28Q.text: Now I need a membership! Within a week I was invited to visit Dot Dot Dot twice by my good comrades. Finding the door may be a tad bit difficult, I won't provide any clues ( it's actually kind of fun looking for it, mysterious). The banner around the room is lively and fresh. The drink presentation is impeccable. Once I become a member (only $10) I will explore every drink on the menu and look forward to being blown away by the craftsmanship of the well put together the cocktail menu.

Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States

SzKm6HBbmdoxTMFRuvmJnA.text: Tonight was absolutely fabulous and it's mainly due to the amazing crew at Dot Dot Dot!!   When we arrived it was close to 1am and they close at 2am. The service was still amazing. We were quickly greeted and taken to seats at the bar. There weren't many patrons inside and they quickly cleared out. It was so cool having the whole place to ourselves.   We got to really talk to Andrew our bartender and Steven. We discussed the new hours, the new menu and the very diverse array of liquors they have available. Andrew was so knowledgeable and entertaining.   Andrew is an amazing bartender. We had a Bumbu Rum daiquiri, the Penicillin and after much conversation about it we tried the "Boulevardier" of Broken Dreams. Amazing!!! I was so impressed by all of the drinks. The daiquiri was so simple with only 3 ingredients but so tasty. Both the Penicillin and the Boulevardier were very refreshing. The Boulevardier has the signature lemon wedge with the burned Dot Dot Dot emblem on it and the Penicillin had a huge square ice cube that provided a fun optical illusion. I would definitely recommend trying any of these drinks.   I have to get back in soon to try the new food menu and try to conquer the complete drink menu!!!   All in all I'm in love with Dot Dot Dot. I'm sooo glad they are located in such a great location, support the local distilleries and have an amazing staff!!!   Dot Dot Dot  4237 Park Rd, Unit B Charlotte, NC 28209 Sunday April 15, 2018 1am

BYzevE_woQCMITN-KEGmDg.text: It sounds like a great concept but a poor execution. We waited outside talking with the person outside before you could get into the restaurant. He check our ID's but never put our name on the list. Once we saw people who came and put our name in after we got there We said something. He was just like my fault you will get the next available table. It still took 10 mins to get a table and when we went in there were a few empty and even space at the bar. It says you have to pay $10 to become a member however no one ever check if you were a member. it also stats that you can bring only 3 guest. We say parties of 6 or more go in with only one person claiming to be a member. It seems like they don't follow their own rules and they are just out to make extra money.  Once we got in the atmosphere was a speakeasy feel. The drinks were pricey. I expected for it to be above average however it was above expectations. We ordered a drink each and our bill came to $34 excluding tax. I can by a full meal for that. The only saving grace for this place was that while we were waiting the bartender came out and offered a drink to some of the people waiting in line.

photos.caption: Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States

dDFGUXdYlsC9v3ZivsbolA.text: Dot Dot Dot opened opened up about a year ago with a goal in mind of taking the Charlotte drink scene to a new level, and that they did. This is a membership only club($10 per year) that prides themselves on providing excellent drinks and service, and they do it well. I had the pleasure of finally stopping in for a visit recently, and I must say I really enjoyed the vibe and the drinks.     Once you arrive, you definitely get the back alley speakeasy feel as you park and approach the door. Make sure you sign up for the membership online prior to arriving and please read the house rules and primarily their dress code. Many people have left bad reviews for Dot Dot Dot simply because they apparently can't read. No you can't enter in your tank top and flip flops, sorry folks. This is an upscale establishment and should be though of as such.   I tried several drinks here, all of which were really good. We had already eaten dinner so I didn't have food, but will be back to try that at another time. I won't go into a ton of detail on the specific drinks since they change, but they definitely have something for everyone. The hot box was the coolest drink of the night as it's brought out and "released" at the table surrounding you in smoky goodness. I also tried the Richardson, strawberry fizz, the Hildalgo, and Blueberry Buck. All of them were great.  I'd definitely say read the reviews, but any reviews containing complaints about the dress code or not being able to get in because membership was not purchased should be ignored. I'll be back.

B2mNZdsWrmMjM8bgoxB6Pw.text: This on trend and quaint bar is definitely worth a visit and membership.  I always have a good time whether at a table or the bar. Although this establishment is private it is very welcoming and has a come as your are feel.  Really nice servers and talented mixologists.  I love the wine list, the Malbec and Riesling offered are amazing.  I also enjoy their French 75, which is off menu right now but available by request. My last visit I tried the Old Cuban which was good. As for food,  the fried chicken is delicious.  I also enjoyed the lobster mushroom ravioli in a broth.  The portions are not huge but completely satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States. Old Cuban cocktail and lobster f..

GjIf9i__EWG4635hwdztJg.text: I am a huge fan!! Each bartender offers something unique and each one has their own awesome personality! They are talented so I highly recommend letting them make up a cocktail for you! Andrew is a total sweetheart and it's by far my favorite cocktail joint in Charlotte!

DFYFBP9DoADDXGlJmDfM2w.text: Wow! I was so impressed by Dot Dot Dot! 6 of us went for a drink on a Friday night. We waited about 5 minutes outside (under heaters so it wasn't too cold) and then we were taken inside to our table. We were seated in a large company circular booth.  We all ordered cocktails (no food) and we all enjoyed our drinks. Most of the cocktails are around $15.00, so it is pricey, but we felt it was worth it. The vibe of Dot Dot Dot is awesome - you won't feel like you're in Charlotte! It's swanky, moody, and dimly lit. The perfect spot for a date night or fun evening out with friends. Go here for dinner or an after dinner drink. We will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States

dgDoA8IO05KvjjAcc7o0CQ.text: I absolutely enjoyed this gem of a spot tonight. The ambience was perfect, the drinks were even better.  I had The Richardson to start, and another bourbon concoction afterwards.  the charcuterie plate was just as amazing with the house pickled items, cheeses, meats, and accoutrements.   They seat you at the bar to accommodate for busy times, so that was my only complaint, albeit a very minor one.  When I arrived, the bar was half full/half empty and I was seated between two different parties. I would have preferred the empty seat beside me for a bit, but the people I was seated next to were very kind and fun to interact with. I was expecting the bar staff to be much more conservative with their conversation after reviews I'd seen online, but I was pleased to find that there was silliness and an approachability behind the bar.  It didn't feel pretentious once you were seated.  The presentation was lovely, I'll be back many, many times.

photos.caption: Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Richardson

yNbbzRYG4XJVSc5GCnVk-Q.text: First... it is a speakeasy so it is difficult to find. That is part of the allure.  Second... there is a dress code and they adhere to it. Which was nice to dress up and feel loke an adult. Third... cocktails are amazing. Yes they are expensive. Then, again, cocktails are expensive anywhere you go. Fourth... this is where stars were lost. Food. The large cheese plate, although delicious, was so small for the price. It was shocking. The tempura veggies were good but the 2nd round was just potatoes and zucchini. The trout was delicious. Fifth... our phones had no service, so we were all forced to pay attention to each other. That was a nice bonus

cj5efAoDIOQSzZiqjuJ69w.text: Just sayin'... I use the "..." quite often. I like it. But, Saturday night we finally visited the new Park Rd. Shpg. Ctr. (Charlotte) located business,  ... (Dot, dot, dot.)  We had paid our membership months ago (only $10!) and had patiently awaited the opening of this private establishment that billed itself as a sort of "Speakeasy" atmosphere specializing in classic mixed drinks and tapa-like dishes. Our excitement was extinguished as we were first told that we would have a 20-30 minute wait (outside), but were then escorted inside immediately to find an extremely LOUD atmosphere. There were 4 of us, so we tried different "Classic" drinks. Overpriced for the quality, some were good, but a couple were really bad! (That is their specialty?) We ordered almost every item on the food menu: Arrancini, Tempura veggies, Pork skewers, Charcuterie and Shrimp. Quantities were very small (and we KNOW tapas) and just average flavors. I WILL say that they did a good job with the decor; rich colors, nice lamps, pretty bar and attractive ceiling and wall designs, but our corner booth was too warm and the noise overwhelming. I was expecting white tablecloths, candles, "Crooner" music and good food/drinks. ...Been there, done that, won't be back! P.S. Dessert at nearby Amelie's...Excellent!!!

Hjr6x72mijhYsxhB_uQSxA.text: If you are looking for a place for overpriced cocktails and pretentious servers, then this is the place for you. It's a cool atmosphere but I wish I had read the reviews and condescending responses from co-owner Conrad Hunter before we decided to check out Dot Dot Dot. Those kinds of responses do nothing to help your ratings(remember Amy's Baking Company is Scottsdale?). Take the criticism and learn from the,.

xUFEjRQocAK84tTFqgfFyQ.text: The cocktails are delicious but the marketing approach is obviously into making people wait. We were told there would be a 40 minute wait so went nearby to have a drink, they texted us 10 minutes later. We were called 2 more times. We returned, were taken down the long hallway and were asked to wait again. The cocktails are good ($12-18), the place is loud (?consider replacing the tin ceiling with red velvet) Not sure I feel the need to go back.

5Rk-XjWzNx28vnU93I_SIw.text: Amazing flavor, both food and drinks.  Had 3 cocktails from bourbon to light rum based. Awesome flavor.  Waite staff is very knowledgeable and friendly.  Had the scallops with an amazing lemon sauce, turnips & jalapenos!  Awesome flavor!!

s6f3nOCpKVl__-fMHkJG8A.text: The wife and I tried to get in Saturday evening around 11:00 PM but the wait was 45 minutes so I picked up my membership card and went home. Not a negative experience.  We were just tired and decided to try again later.  We live about 200 paces from the front door so no big deal.  We tried again early Sunday evening and got right in.  Although they give you a membership card what you really need to get in is your driver's license.  My wife didn't have hers but they let us in but told us to make sure and have proper ID next time.  Once the doorman lets you in you walk down a long hallway to the hostess.  She escorts you through another door and seats you.  The decor is beautiful.  No TVs which is nice.  Noise level was low but not many people were there.  We sat at a table near the exit.  Waitress was immediately there to take our order.   My wife ordered a Thai Basil Smash and I ordered a Manhattan.  We had already had dinner but wanted to try a food item on the menu so we ordered the GIARDINIERE.  As we received our appetizer the waitress brought us a gin amuse-bouche (on the house appetizer) drink.  It was a little sweet but enjoyable.  The appetizer was really good.  It included some warm almonds, olives, and pickled vegetables.  You could tell by the quality of the vegetables that an experienced chef is in the kitchen.  It tasted very fresh and tangy.  We enjoyed the cocktails as well.    Their House Rules are posted on their website and the 3rd rule is proper dress is required but doesn't go into detail.  It says to refer to rule 2 which says don't be a jerk.  I discussed the dress code with the waitress and she told me its business casual.  No t-shirts, shorts or flip flops.  Apparently the no flip-flop rules is for men only (sexist?). However, I noticed the guy sitting two tables over was wearing shorts and flip flops.  Obviously, they aren't enforcing that rule yet.    Overall it was a pleasant experience and it met my expectations.  It is definitely a pricey experience so be prepared to spend some money.  I will visit occasionally as it is a little expensive for my entertainment budget.

RNTJKwUVXtQ8B8xrNdNL-A.text: I'm member since they opened and when I tried to get in they let someone else before me (they let them buy a membership before us) why would buy a membership for? Awefull service outside, got told 20 min wait and was more like 50 min

aobMzfJ6Tpikuziwhpwc1w.text: My first experience as a member at Dot Dot Dot was a swing and a miss. I thought this was a great concept and the other 7,100 people who became members before me must have thought the same thing. The main issue was the noise inside which was ridiculous at 6:00pm on a Thursday with half of the establishment empty. By the time my girlfriend and I left (6:30) we were yelling across the table at each other. Also the drinks weren't amazing for the prices. I got the Hot Box and my girlfriend got the Mia Tai and they were decent. You can get better drinks in South Park for the price.

ghoOPpqkc8ld6nDDF0LJDg.text: Dot dot dot has gone from decent to worse. I've been here several times and each one has been progressively worse. I recently showed up with a group of 5 and was told that I could use the NoWait App to register my party to enter later after eating at Sir Edmund Halley's. The app did not let you register 5 people for the wait list and we instead registered for 4. When we showed up, we were told we were in the wrong for showing up with one more person and were forced to go back on the wait list which was another 40 minutes (there was no line outside and people were pouring out of the bar). You guys need to do some work with your seating methods. How does one person cause you to have to wait another 40 minutes to be seated? I would like to understand before I come back. I will also be urging others to avoid until this is figured out.

eF6FUUQ2YJEAZ1j80tYKfg.text: I love this place!!  I paid for my membership online a month ago and was handed my card when I arrived.  I was very happy with everything about the experience.  Drinks were well-balanced and tasty, food was delicious, service was attentive and friendly.  The decor is swanky and I love the lack of TVs.  I also love that the barstools are comfortable for hours!!  My other favorite bar in Charlotte is perfect in every way except that the barstools cut off your circulation after about 20 minutes, the ones at Dot Dot Dot don't do that.  The music here is also perfect for the intended atmosphere and isn't so loud that you have to raise your voice to have a conversation.  The only con for me is that it's not closer to my office or home, but I still expect to go there a couple times a month.

M1LMiPvR2gxZcKN8akZCtQ.text: The service is bar none and the cocktails are out of this world. I specifically love the Strawberry Fizz. Oh, and the cheese board is perfection!

nzi4Q1EK009hqc7y0wNbdQ.text: No sign with restaurant name, front door on a shipping dock next to two dumpsters. We show up 10 minutes before "the members" that invited us.  We were denied entry until "the members" arrived. Door opens and we have to walk down a very long and very dark hallway, taking baby steps walking super slow so as not to break an ankle. Drinks were good, food was marginal.  The "exclusive club" BS doesn't work for me, when the experience can't back it up.  I don't plan on returning, and certainly wouldn't pay a dime for a membership to a wanna-be exclusive club that just is not that good.

yMWWOaqzYeC07KPO3Mn1zQ.text: A little pricey but you're paying for a pretty awesome atmosphere and great service.  Drinks and appetizers were good and its a very well designed establishment.

-rWr0Xn3j_1sbOfv5UCUmA.text: Had such an amazing experience here. The short rib small plate was one of the best things I've ever tasted. The drinks are great and the service was outstanding. I would 100% recommend to anyone and will definitely be returning!

XQ2Avd-3VJY6BSAF7Wi15A.text: A great addition to the Park Road area. They have a good selection of light bites and I loved the Front Porch Punch! The atmosphere is very cozy, although it can get a bit loud, but i am sure this is something they will work out as the venue matures. Overall this is definitely a place you can go and enjoy a laid back atmosphere, good eats and a nice variety of drinks.

JBqGrYLF39pSyY1LPLVJlQ.text: Went here for the first time last night and was a huge fan! Definitely worth the $10 membership. Great atmosphere at the bar area and incredibly friendly and personable staff. Excellent drinks!!! Upscale so proper attire is required. It will definitely be a place I go back to.

mCHGuioNjEC6i-Yc3wq3vA.text: Food was great. Drinks were okay not something very crafty or different. Priced okay... good hospitality and service. Maybe I will go again if they carry pappy wan winkle.,,

Pd1rI6acTu6kchcfKw3y5Q.text: This is one of my favorite places to have a cocktail in Charlotte.  I'm a member,  and have never had an issue.  People need to realize that it is a private club, and it's much easier to buy a membership online rather than waiting until you get to the door.  The place his a cool, shill, but upscale vibe. If you want a innovative, expertly crafted cocktail this is the place to go, I don;t mind paying for quality, and I've never been disappointed at Dot Dot Dot. The sames goes for the food, which is mostly tapas fare, creative, unique, and delicious.  Let;s be clear... this is not the place to chug Bud Lite, and scarf down chicken wings... and thank God it's Not.  It's a classic and classy cocktail bar... something not often found in Charlotte.  I also truly appreciate the dress code. I don;t want to be surrounded by flip flops and smelly feet, or people in shorts dressed like they're going to the lake, while I'm trying to enjoy a single malt scotch.  Again 5 stars for the ambiance, cocktails, and food.

XDQR_CXLpK9d8Q95wAkttA.text: I was extremely skeptical about a "speak easy" located in the back of a strip mall. After all, some places here in Charlotte that are in prime locations are so underwhelming what good could possible come out of a cocktail bar that is located in such an odd spot?  Well, my concerns were unfounded. This place is sexy! Once you get through the entrance door and walk down the hallway that is soberly lid you enter the main room that features some tin ceilings and Art Deco metalwork. No loud music and NO TV!!! Extra points for the latter!  The cocktails are well done. It is truly refreshing that there are actually bartenders in Charlotte who truly know how to mix certain drinks.   The door should be even more strict and certain procedures re the membership card need to be ironed out. Why do I have one if you only want my ID anyway? But this is just a minor flaw.  The wait staff is knowledgeable and attentive. Management is very interested in making sure that guests enjoy the place...and the drinks.  Congratulations on a great addition to the Charlotte bar scene!

_YsbtvHqjRfdmZ3F4nJp3g.text: My friend and I went to Dot Dot Dot on a week night around 8 o'clock. She had a membership card. I did not. The door guy flirted with her shamelessly while I dug for my ID. I did not have to pay the $10 membership fee because I was her "guest". (Have to say, I don't really get the membership fee.) I loved the atmosphere....even in the restroom. Great decor. We ordered the Beef Tartar and the Salmon. Both were extremely delicious and had a great presentation. I ordered an Old Fashion and was impressed with their logo branding on the orange twist. The place has a sexy vibe. Thirty minutes in, two other friends joined us. The hostess easily accommodated us moving to a 4 top. Overall a good experience. I will go back for sure.

Lr7Sz-rVUX-pgsnbc6W8Jw.text: Loved this hard to find little speakeasy!  We sat at the bar and watched the bartenders make some very cool cocktails.  The enjoyed what they were doing and enjoyed telling us about the ingredients and combos.  We sampled several cocktails and they were really really good.  The appetizers we tried were AMAZING!  Three words...ORDER THE GNOCCHI.  I will be back for that for sure.  Very fun and entertaining atmosphere, with great food and cocktails.

l8y5C_r6yr0mRFRFI8Zj0A.text: Very disappointing service, especially at the door. I live for fancy cocktail bars, but the vibe and attitude of the staff is underwhelming. The body builder guy as the door was needlessly rude to us when we walked up. I'm not sure if he was having a bad day or what, but I haven't experienced something quite like that. For what it's worth, I get on yelp almost daily and this is the first review I've ever written. Call me inspired.

8R-UQyxFJhLlrug1fCtq-w.text: I love this establishment! I makes me fill all Great Gatsby every time I go. I love the hostess Ingrid!!! She always remembers me when I come to town and she always has a joke to put a smile on my face. This is my secret place to bring all my friends to when I'm in the city! I'm even looking to have my bridal party here for drinks soon. Keep up the good work you guys! Im throughly impressed

oukF1O3xwhqf84o8MQSBew.text: A beautiful, stylish and sophisticated establishment. Superior cocktails meticulously crafted. Each one, sexy and elegant with unexpected touches that delighted the senses. The cuisine will astound and amaze the most refined palates. Dress your best and have an experience that will not soon be forgotten.

TB17ogT0QLnI-ocBDYkB3A.text: Enjoyed the drinks and the plates were amazing. My friends ha stage front porch rum, strawberry fizz, and the final countdown. I ordered the hot box and it did not disappoint.  There is only one other place who makes this drink in comparison and that is Dogwood. The food is quality and fantastic. The cheese and charcuterie is good with quality choices but was not my favorite tonight. By far my favorite was the drunken chicken and portabella skewer and the pork spiedie skewer.  Oh and I liked the gravlax too. Dot Dot Dot is a dark and intimate. The atmosphere is louder than I expected but isn't every place loud. I liked the diverse ages coming in, and it leans more to the 35+ age group.  The service was superb.

xgjUdj3HOjsdWn5QRmyvxQ.text: This private club (join on their website) is fantastic.  Recently opened, the drinks, service, and food would make you believe that the place had been there for years.  The cocktails are well made and the selection of liquors is quite broad - something for every palate.  The food is made for nibbling as you sip and is quite good.  We were extremely pleased with both the Cheese & Charcuterie as well as the Bone Marrow.  The atmosphere is really nice.  Low lighting, soft background music, the low hum of conversation all combine to enhance the experience.  The service (gigantic kudos to Ashley for taking such good care of us) was excellent in all respects.  We were made to feel as if we were regulars who had been stopping by for years.  Classy, classy, classy, all the way...

Jm4dwkGb-eZ8wGADGW_2aQ.text: Just showed up at 10:40 on a Saturday night my friends messaged me that they were denied entry because one of the male partners was wearing open toed shoes...expensive slides btw... arrived 5 minutes later seeing several females, including myself wearing open toed shoes.. got to the door and the bouncer first told us there was a five  to ten  minute wait then said we could come right in, saw my friends and sAid I already told you man, you can't come in, you have open toed shoes, I looked around to the five woman plus me with open toed shoes and questioned their policy at which point he Became hostile and said their OFFICIAL policy is men can't have  open toed shoes, I wanted to speak to a manager  but the point here is blatantly biased I am calling on anyone and everyone to boycott this establishment!!! It is listed a private club so they can make their rules but what if a trans person or drag person showed up? Also denied... from having a drink??? Really!?? A g-damn specialty cocktail???

MRd_c0CNnjt3moPbpZETsA.text: Hands down, this is one of the best places to come in Charlotte. My wife and I went on a Friday evening, and we enjoyed it immensely. My experience was the absolute best. I especially love that a membership is required, it provides a sense of exclusivity while garnering safety and security. Honestly I can appreciate that your website provides information on what to expect. It should be viewed as being proactive. But then you experience some patrons who think that they are the exception to all the worlds rules. I think the dress code idea is necessary, it sort of puts everyone on the same playing field and creating some inclusiveness within the establishment. Now my issue is that my wife wants her own membership to bring her friends.   Also, I've used Yelp for years and never considered creating a profile until after my visit at Dot Dot Dot.  BRAVO, job well done my friend!!!!!

cvAQ41BJQEtTy-_XVb1Ijg.text: This is THE most refreshing addition to Charlotte.   A friend and I visited Dot Dot Dot and from the time we were greeted by the doorman to the closing of our tab, it was a phenomenal experience. We casually sat at the bar with Ashley and Pete (superb bar-keeps) who know their craft. I drank a True Manhattan and it was divine. This is a True Speak-Easy. The small plate short ribs are delicious; the best I've had in Charlotte.  If you want to escape the urban factor and have a world-class experience, then this is your place to go.   What you won't find at Dot Dot Dot is FUBU, flip-flops and club wear. What you WILL find is an enchanting experience to remember.   Meir

F_5rAoPHays8Z0yB5P-fgw.text: Amazing drinks, and a definite must if you're looking for a cool place to sit and relax with friends. Atmosphere and food is great as well.

o886X4sE7gRxLTJVxQ1PrQ.text: Coolest place in Charlotte! Cocktails and food are amazing, service is excellent. Highly recommend.

15tmAic3-LcecVlw48QO4g.text: All I can say is wow. I had a Manhattan and an Old Fashion. Perfect. To say my wife and I shared the Creole BBQ Shrimp and the Charcuterie. The house also have is an incredible shrimp dish they are thinking of for the menu. Everything was superb. And the service was devine.

photos.caption: Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States. Old Fashion
Photo of Dot Dot Dot - Charlotte, NC, United States. Incredible cocktails

IOajqk80gzR_80KSxyRerg.text: Great classic cocktails, and terrific top quality small plates, this place is a gem. Love it.

zAcsIyqf6aF9XG7EWc7jjw.text: This place is something special. There is great food and incredible drinks from mixed to straight. The servers are nothing short of perfect. The dress code is business casual making for an  inviting atmosphere that anyone can and will feel a part of.

ZUjsng9_7kwajj3RhuDBYw.text: Neat new addition to the back lot at Park Road Shopping Center. My wife and I stopped in for a pre-dinner drink to celebrate our anniversary. First off, I recommend checking out the website and purchasing a membership in advance of your visit. It is $10 and allows you to bring up to 3 guests. When you show up, they scan your driver's licence and in you go. Overall entry ambiance is pretty neat - you walk down a narrow brick corridor, which opens up to the actual room at the end. I will say this place was larger than I expected and was fairly busy and loud (to be expected on a Friday night). I will say the noise is what cost them my 5th star as I'm used to the Cellar or the Punch Room where it is a bit quieter and feels a bit more exclusive. However, I was impressed with the service. When we told our waitress that it was our anniversary, she brought out 2 glasses of champagne on the house. As for the drinks, I ended up ordering the Hot Box - a mix of bourbon, scotch, and bitters smoked with pecan wood. The drink was perfectly mixed and the presentation was fun as it is brought out in a box with smoke from the wood embers. Overall I will consider returning to check out more of their drink menu and perhaps part of their food menu.

HiuaIm-dPJDPamx8kyU0uw.text: Came for an after work happy hour drink. The ambiance is unique and like nothing else in Charlotte. You have to be let in by a guest which is pretty cool. Once you get in the decor is very intimate. The service was great. We had three drinks all very unique which were recommended by the waitress. I was hesitant of mine at first because it had liquor and red wine in it but it turned out to be very good. We ordered the small plate beef tartare and it was also great. I would recommend this place and definitely would come back.

rW6rZJS-W-hTsPzGakbpNA.text: I can't really give it a star rating because we were denied at the door due to dress code.  My husband was wearing nice leather flip flops and apparently that's not allowed. Not sure if my sandals would have been ok because we didn't get that far. It's JULY in Charlotte.  Not sure what else a man wears with shorts.  Bottom line is check the dress code.

T6aEstVxzKVA4ewfBEAonQ.text: Fantastic venue. Would give it 4 or 5 stars for ambience, and beverage menu. However am giving it 2 stars for repeated poor service on an administrative level. Visited for the first time in early Jan 2018 with friends. Loved it. Went online the next day and purchased the $10 membership. Never received an email confirm. Never received the card in the mail. Called and left 2 messages (that were never returned) asking when it would be mailed. The $10 was indeed charged to my AMEX on 1/14/18.  Went back with several friends on Thurs May 17th. We arrived at 8pm. Explained the situation to the guy working the front door. He said I was "not in the system" but he would have a manager talk with me to resolve after I explained the charge date and the never returned calls. When we arrived - the place was at most 20% filled. After an hour I asked the waitress about the manager and she rolled her eyes and said said, "sorry, we are so unorganized here". Can anyone who works there and reads this - please tell me who to call to resolve. Seems ridiculous that this is hard to resolve as we are only talking about $10. But evidently it is. I am posting this as i find it hard to believe I am the sole customer to experience this issue.

-MGMcawxX9ZVQ_AbYp3vPw.text: Apparently "Southern Hospitality" doesn't apply here. What a disappointment and a waste of a great concept...

1h9qpsxK76n1v9pkMhrv8A.text: A little hard to find, but once you're inside it's a great new spot for cocktails in Charlotte.

uMXnDC1sZBL_P02ccP5LGw.text: Doesn't live up to the hype. Service is sub-par. Some of the cocktails are good, some are average, not worth the price. To wait 20 minutes to gain entry and then deal with rude staff/average drinks is not the best use of time. Management thrives on exclusivity and not the product.
